topics.body:
I just had a amazing idea for a tv series: start off with a good idea for a cartoon show write out a basic idea, then take every imaginable geeky fanbase genre and pander to them and have fetishy undertones with stuff, but make all the pandering completely unimportant story wise to the degree that all the stuff is pretty much decoration so as to not mess with the story.

Hypothetically have like a main character with say bunny ears and in the story it's considered completely normal and it's never relevant to the story so it's just there; or like her girlfriend be a trap and because in canon it's considered completely normal it's never important story wise.

Why do I say it's a amazing idea?  Cause if it's unimportant story wise you could get away with *SOOOO MUCH* stuff that you normally would never be able to get past the censors.  Like you could have a gay couple and lesbian couples in the show, but so long as it's never brought up in any important story wise you could sail right past the censors.


What I mean by this is think about how much Totally Spies got away with in a children's cartoon; now make all that stuff even more covert so you can shove almost anything you want into the show without getting in trouble.

Theoretically you can get away with anything in a children's cartoon if you're subtle enough about it.
